benchmark_details.name: Ethical Decision Support Assessment Checklist (EDSAC)
benchmark_details.overview: The study introduces the EDSAC framework to evaluate the ethical reasoning capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) in construction project management contexts, assessing performance against real-world ethical scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To empirically assess the ethical reasoning capacities of LLMs and establish a framework for their evaluation in the context of construction project management.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The scenarios used were static and the pool of interviewees and tested LLMs was finite.

data.source: Test responses from three LLMs (ChatGPT, Gemini, LLaMA) evaluated against twelve ethical scenarios designed for construction decision-making.
data.annotation: Responses were scored using a purpose-built checklist that evaluates ethical soundness, legal compliance, fairness, transparency, contextual relevance, actionable recommendations, and bias sensitivity.

methodology.calculation: Performance scores were calculated based on the EDSAC framework, which evaluates responses on various ethical dimensions.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the level of ethical reasoning capacity of LLM responses, influencing their appropriateness for ethical decision-making.
methodology.baseline_results: ChatGPT scored 4.35, Gemini scored 4.21, and LLaMA scored 3.92 out of 5 across ethical criteria.
methodology.validation: Inter-rater reliability was ensured by having two researchers independently score the responses, with discrepancies resolved through discussion.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Consent was obtained for the interview process.
